name: Perfection Kills v1.2
description:
I played a lot with @Dydra's Replication Kills and some variants. I kept noticing a the runner often hitting Archives as their central run before hitting a remote, to keep me from getting my Subliminals back, or to fish out trashed agendas. Admittedly, maybe that's poor play on my part, as I wasn't playing enough ICE on Archives. However, @Dydra's original is light on ICE...when it's hard to come by, I'd rather not spend the money or click to install and rez there. So instead, I dropped in 2x Shock! to increase the taxation of an Archives run.

@Dydra tried to talk me out of this. I'm glad I didn't listen, because Shock! has been a hero in this deck...setting up a win situation when hidden in Archives, and scaring away runners when face up. Having them hit 2x Shock! while scoring 3-4 points from Archives is nice during those times you can only track down a single Punitive!

Still running Hokusai in place of Ronin. Loving that call.

I've been playing with the ICE build in this deck, as that's where it falls short for me. I can't quite get it to do what it should do (be taxing) beyond early game. This is my latest iteration, bringing in Hive as a taxing barrier, Shinobi as a tougher Sentry, a single Roto for an extra shot at Program trashing, and Whirlpool for fun...because having fun at the Runner's expense is what Jinteki is all about!

name: Slamarchy
description:
I think it is odd how so many people import in Mimic, Corroder, Yog, and Suckers, yet a lot of Noise decks focus more on milling and not accomplishing much rather than running, running, and running! This deck's intention is to do just that.

For a long time I focused on Siphon, but, in truth, their programs are what make them so strong. For that reason I decided to lean on Chip and SMC, with Opus as a strong econ--which they lack. Opus in this deck essentially comes at no drawback via Djinn and Grimoire. The deck can support it.

I tried Knight, but, in truth, it was dying to frequently, esp. since I wanna Parasite the crap outta problematic ice. In the end, I like the fixed breaker suite, with SMC, and Chip for ambushes.

name: Painted Over (Paint it Black v2.0)
description:
Kit, Paintbrush, Gordian, Snitch, and...

...wait, no Blackguard?

Sadly, while once the namesake of this deck, Blackguard has been removed. As much as I wanted the Snitch/BG combo to work in a Paintbrush deck, this particular one doesn't have the econ to get it out when it's needed. More importantly, I almost never needed it, and when I did Snitch was doing what I really wanted...protecting be from nasty unrezzed ICE, and providing me information about what's coming.

It now sits next in my exercise room with a bunch of other dusty, unused equipment.

In it's place comes Dinosaurus, a solid (if less exciting) fit for this deck, especially with Gordian as my breaker. I've also squeezed in some FAOs for a cheap event-based version of what I had Blackguard for...to get ICE rezzed. I even get the side benefit of having some trashed. If I can use 2 out of the 3 in a game, I'm getting exactly what I wanted from Blackguard, but for way, way cheaper.

Streamlined in other places...went to 3x Tinkering because I was never sad to see it, replaced 3x Dirty Laundry with 2x Sure Gamble to improve my burst economy...that's about it.

Thoughts welcome!

name: Ain't nobody got time for that
description: Just a real pain to get in to those remotes man

name: Haas Effiency
Bernice in the Big City v.1.0
description:
Going all in with ChiLo!

Strat in a Nutshell

Create economic scoring windows for Astros and Beales by baiting the runner into the annoying agendas.

Notable Cards

ChiLo + Caduceus/Viper

These cards don't land tags very often. But you can occasionally force the runner to pay out the ass if they face check a Caddie or a Viper over a ChiLo without the right breaker.

Bernice Mai + ChiLo

Costs five creds (almost always 7 because we're Making News) to avoid two tags. With TGTBT that's 3 tags, 1 of which is unavoidable. And with NAPD... just sit back and let the runner squirm for a second. Make sure you rez ChiLo first and before they access!

Scorch + Archived Memories

I like to think Bernice and Elizabeth "Boom Boom" Mills are old college gal pals. So if the opportunity ever presents itself, give her a call.

Private Security Force

I find these are so much easier to sneak out because of NAPDs. Not comfortable with including a second one. But if you do score one, it makes everything else much more threatening.

Private Contracts

Why not Melange/Pad/Marked Accounts? Pads and Marked Accounts are a little too slow for this deck and won't help dig you out of a hole (which you may very well find yourself in from time to time). Melange is too hard to protect and not as flexible as PC making it the comfortable middle ground. So long as you always leave yourself an insurance of 3 creds after investing in, say, sticking an expensive Bernice trace, you can rez PC and click your whole turn to recover.

Uroburos

The wild card. Pros: two base trace 4's. Cons: strength could be higher, expensive. I've cycled this card out with Flare and Snoop. I think Flare is too expensive but it almost always does me good when I do rez it. Snoop is fun and seeing the runner's hand is invaluable knowledge as this deck often scores agendas behind ice that doesn't hard end the run.

Match-Ups

Standard Breaker Suites

Try to bait them into TGTBT's and NAPDs. Pay attention to their credits and drop an Astro when their creds are down.

Usual Suspects: Could be anyone.

Tag-Me Runners

Watch out for these diesel-ed up crack heads! Pay attention to what resources they're installing; Masanori and Josh B are often sure signs of of these reckless banditos. They often won't go tag-me until they have a Plascrete but be wary of giving them tags regardless because of Data Leak Reversal. They don't often drop one on anything but click 1 so you won't know they have it until they're hitting you with it. Once the tags start to pile up, use your Psychographics to sneak a safe Astro or overscore a Beale. Save your Archived Memories to pull the Psychographics back instead of scorched.

Usual Suspects: Anarchs and Andy

Runners with 1 Base Link

Don't forget about the Base Link! Especially if you're trying to end the run with a Viper...

Usual Suspects: Reina, Andy, Kate etc.

Runners running Toolbox, Dysons, Borrowed Satellites, etc.

lol. Take a deep breath. Tell yourself Net Police is still too situational a card and take it one mandatory draw at a time.

Closing Thoughts

This deck is... alright.

name: Imthewhiterabbit’s Runner Cube (240)
description: Faction Balanced (70/70/70) Program/Breakers Balanced (27/27/27) Economy too high? Breakers too low?

Just a fun deck I put together for Shaper night at my local netrunner league.

name: NBN Wes
S1 Multizone
S1 Multizone
Do You Want to Access?
description:
Remote servers should be a gauntlet of pain.

Keep Snares in HQ unless it's to the point where the runner has to run on anything you install. Feel free to throw Shocks into Archives.

Snoop is all-star ICE in this deck: it lets you know what to expect from the runner in the near future every time they encounter it. And if you're lucky enough to get a power counter on it, it serves as on-demand damage whenever you're ready to hit them with a Snare, Shock, Neural EMP or Punitive Counterstrike.

name: HB - ETF
Noise and the Magic Whale
description: stolen

name: Slamarchy 2.0
description: I think it is odd how so many people import in Mimic, Corroder, Yog, and Suckers, yet a lot of Noise decks focus more on milling and not accomplishing much rather than running, running, and running!

name: Noise Fork
description: My take on the concept of "Forking". General concept is if your opponent tries to do something, you put so much pressure in another place they have to make the decision on what they want to lose. This is done in the form of noise/DLR on archives, medium on R&D, AS on HQ, and knight for remote sniping. Deck is a bit unrefined, but the core concept is fun to play.

name: Good Ol' Gabe
description: Been playing this at league. Super aggro Gabe with solid opener ratio. Cortez early means you either break their bank OR get in on a siphon. With 2 knight and 1 peacock, e3 is solid around and just trounces Bioroids. Very solid little deck that will just get better with Honor and Profit.

name: Whizzard's Gambit
Noise Deck, Take 1
description: First attempt to build a Runner deck. Focusing on actually having money and memory to do stuff.
